description: a(n) = number of divisors of n-th perfect number.
comments: The number of divisors of n-th perfect number that are powers of 2 is equal to a(n)/2, assuming there are no odd perfect numbers. The number of divisors of n-th perfect number that are multiples of n-th Mersenne prime A000668(n) is also equal to a(n)/2, assuming there are no odd perfect numbers. (See A000043). - _Omar E. Pol_, Feb 28 2008
links: Omar E. Pol, Determinacion geometrica de los numeros primos y perfectos.
author: _Labos Elemer_, Jun 14 2001
